moves.1. c4: this was an interesting game where i had to conserve my nerves against a powerful and intimidating attack. hopefully there was nothing probing in it, and i had the opportunity to claim back the center to take the initiative, until i had the possibility to gain a pawn, There is wher my opponent decided to "give" me a bishop... the end is less funny.
moves.5... h6 6. Nf3 d6 7. Ba3: this is a try, first time i do it. Won't do it again, there is nothing there for white light bishop
moves.10... Nh7 11. Nd2 f5: f5 from black: always a threat!
moves.12. f3 Qg5 13. Bc1: the bishop has to go back before the a1 rook could enter into the defence game. but it will be all right. I calculated it.
moves.13... f4: closing the attack: it gives me some tempos...
moves.14. Nb3 Bh3: of course: this was a possibility, but, once again, nothing decisive.
moves.15. Rf2: no black dark bishop, no knight can attack this strong rook.
moves.18. Be1 Rf8: here you are... but many people for such a small place, isn't it?
moves.19... a5: this is exactly what i wanted: close a place for your knight
moves.24... Qe5 25. Rd1 Qxd4 26. Rxd4: "this is the place i always wanted to beeeee"
moves.27. c5: not quite. if you take it, i take you. If dxc5, i take you... so back up!
moves.27... Bxa4: wazup??? i told you to back up!
moves.28. Rxa4 dxc5 29. Rxa5: i have two versions: or he was distracted, or he thought: my best chance is to go on with these two isolated pawns... but really they are too isolated... and my bishops are strong. And your knight is so far!
moves.31. Kh1: so the king gets a room
moves.31... Rc6 32. Bc4+: blockade to give time to the other pieces. the check was a bonus
moves.32... Kh8 33. Rfb2 Rd8: i expected Rb8, so i could make Bf2, but he is looking for the easy mate.
moves.38... Rc8 39. Bd2 Rf8 40. Rc6: hard to protect two pawns with one rook... the end is an esay one.
